newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dlr falls sharply vs yen after Sakakibara comments.
newsitem.headline: Dlr falls sharply vs yen after Sakakibara comments.

text.p: *Dollar fell sharply in late Tokyo on comments from Ministry of Finance (MOF) senior official Eisuke Sakakibara that it is possible yen may strengthen, based on its movements over past year, and it could strengthen to 103 yen to dollar.
*Comment set off sales, including hedge sales from trust banks and probably life insurers, which in turn triggered consecutive waves of stop-loss selling.

*Another city bank dealer said Japanese authorities may be making efforts to talk dollar down ahead of May 20 meeting of Federal Open Market Committee, which is widely expected to raise U.S. rates again. "Since the dollar is likely to be bought then, they want to take it lower now in preparation, hoping to limit its post-FOMC gains to around 125 yen," he added.
